DGACM.relevance_comment: Mandate: directs the Secretary‑General to convene the Conference of the States Parties not later than one year following entry into force. Connection to DGACM PPB: DGACM is responsible for providing substantive and technical secretariat support and conference‑servicing (planning, scheduling, meeting management) for United Nations conferences at Headquarters and duty stations. Convening the Conference will require the operational conference‑servicing functions (room scheduling, documentation, interpretation, registration, webcasting, etc.) that DGACM’s programme describes and normally implements on behalf of the Secretary‑General.

Mandate: requires the Secretary‑General to provide the necessary secretariat services to the Conference of the States Parties. Connection to DGACM PPB: DGACM’s programme explicitly states responsibility for substantive and technical secretariat support to United Nations conferences and intergovernmental bodies, including provision of meetings, documentation, interpretation and related secretariat services at Headquarters and other duty stations. This paragraph creates an obligation on the Secretary‑General to provide secretariat services that, in practice, DGACM implements.

Mandate: sets out specific secretariat functions — (a) assist the Conference and make arrangements and provide necessary services for sessions; (b) upon request, assist States Parties in providing information to the Conference; (c) ensure coordination with secretariats of relevant international and regional organizations. Connection to DGACM PPB: these enumerated secretariat tasks map directly to DGACM’s core functions (conference planning and coordination, documentation and information services, liaison/coordination with other secretariats and duty stations, and provision of meeting support and multilingual services) as described throughout the programme plan.

Mandate: requires the Secretary‑General to be notified of 24/7 points of contact, to keep an updated register of those points of contact and to circulate the updated list annually to States Parties. Connection to DGACM PPB: DGACM provides and maintains enterprise conference and information management services (portals, registers, documentation systems and dissemination platforms) and supports the management and circulation of intergovernmental information. Maintaining and publishing an updated register of contact points for the 24/7 network is an operational secretariat function that DGACM’s systems and services are positioned to implement on behalf of the Secretary‑General.
